pledge.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a serious promise or agreement, especially one made publicly or officially
pledge.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Parents make a pledge to take their children to rehearsals.
Eisenhower fulfilled his election pledge to end the war in Korea.
a pledge of support for the plan
the government’s pledge to make no deals with terrorists
pledge.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a promise to give money to an organization
pledge.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Donors have made pledges totaling nearly $4 million.
a pledge of $200 to the public TV station
pledge.translation[0].definitions[2].def: something valuable that you leave with someone else as proof that you will do what you have agreed to do
pledge.translation[0].definitions[3].def: someone who has promised to become a member of a fraternity or sorority at an American university

pledge.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something
pledge.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Moore pledged $100,000 to the orchestra at the fund-raising dinner.

Herrera pledged that his company would give aid to schools.
Trade unions pledged themselves to resist the government plans.
pledge.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to make someone formally promise something

pledge.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something
